trans-unit.source: An abstract class that enables you to associate easing functions with a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.DecimalAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> key frame animation.
For an example of using an object similar to this one, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDoubleKeyFrame>.

This class is used as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DecimalKeyFrameCollection> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DecimalAnimationUsingKeyFrames> to animate a <xref:System.Decimal> property value along a set of key frames.

This <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DecimalKeyFrame> interpolates between the <xref:System.Decimal> value of the previous key frame and its own value linearly with an easing function to produce its output value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDecimalKeyFrame"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDecimalKeyFrame"></xref> class with the specified value.
The initial value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDecimalKeyFrame"></xref> class with the specified value and key time.
The initial value.
The initial key time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDecimalKeyFrame"></xref> class with the specified value, key time, and easing function.
The initial value.
The initial key time.
The easing function.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable"></xref> derived class.
When creating a derived class, you must override this method.
Animation classes inherit indirectly from <xref:System.Windows.Freezable>.
Because of this, you need to override the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BackEase.CreateInstanceCore%2A> method to construct a custom animation object.
The new instance.
Gets or sets the easing function applied to the key frame.
The easing function applied to the key frame.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.EasingDecimalKeyFrame.EasingFunction"></xref> dependency property.
Interpolates, according to the easing function used, between the previous key frame value and the value of the current key frame, using the supplied progress increment.
The value to animate from.
A value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, that specifies the percentage of time that has elapsed for this key frame.
The output value of this key frame given the specified base value and progress.
